Package org.neo4j.index.internal.gbptree

Class GenerationSafePointerPair

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.index.internal.gbptree.GenerationSafePointerPair
  • class GenerationSafePointerPair
extends Object
    Two GenerationSafePointer forming the basis for a B+tree becoming generate-aware.

    Generally a GSP fall into one out of these categories:

    • STABLE: generation made durable and safe by a checkpoint
    • UNSTABLE: generation which is currently under evolution and isn't safe until next checkpoint
    • EMPTY: have never been written
    There are variations of pointers written in UNSTABLE generation:
    • BROKEN: written during a concurrent page cache flush and wasn't flushed after that point before crash
    • CRASH: pointers written as UNSTABLE before a crash happened (non-clean shutdown) are seen as CRASH during recovery

    Combinations of above mentioned states of the two pointers dictates which, if any, to read from or write to. From the perspective of callers there's only "read" and "write", the two pointers are hidden.

    All methods are static and all interaction is made with primitives.

    Flags in results from read/write method calls. Pointer is 6B so msb 2B can be used for flags, although the most common case (successful read) has its flag zeros so a successful read doesn't need any masking to extract pointer. 

         WRITE
 [_1__,____][___ ,    ][ ... 6B pointer data ... ]
  ▲ ▲▲ ▲▲▲▲  ▲▲▲
  │ ││ ││││  │││
  │ ││ ││││  └└└────────────────────────────────────── POINTER STATE B (on failure)
  │ ││ │└└└─────────────────────────────────────────── POINTER STATE A (on failure)
  │ │└─└────────────────────────────────────────────── GENERATION COMPARISON (on failure):FLAG_GENERATION_B_BIG,
  │ │                                                  FLAG_GENERATION_EQUAL, FLAG_GENERATION_A_BIG
  │ └───────────────────────────────────────────────── 0:FLAG_SLOT_A/1:FLAG_SLOT_B (on success)
  └─────────────────────────────────────────────────── 0:FLAG_SUCCESS/1:FLAG_FAIL
 
         READ failure
 [10__,____][__  ,    ][ ... 6B pointer data ... ]
    ▲▲ ▲▲▲▲  ▲▲
    ││ ││││  ││
    ││ │││└──└└─────────────────────────────────────── POINTER STATE B
    ││ └└└──────────────────────────────────────────── POINTER STATE A
    └└──────────────────────────────────────────────── GENERATION COMPARISON:
                                                       FLAG_GENERATION_B_BIG, FLAG_GENERATION_EQUAL,
                                                       FLAG_GENERATION_A_BIG
 
         READ success
 [00_ ,    ][    ,    ][ ... 6B pointer data ... ]
    ▲
    └───────────────────────────────────────────────── 0:FLAG_SLOT_A/1:FLAG_SLOT_B

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public static long read​(PageCursor cursor,
                        long stableGeneration,
                        long unstableGeneration,
                        GBPTreeGenerationTarget generationTarget)
        Reads a GSPP, returning the read pointer or a failure. Check success/failure using isSuccess(long) and if failure extract more information using failureDescription(long).
        Parameters:
        cursor - PageCursor to read from, placed at the beginning of the GSPP.
        stableGeneration - stable index generation.
        unstableGeneration - unstable index generation.
        generationTarget - target to write the generation of the selected pointer.
        Returns:
        most recent readable pointer, or failure. Check result using isSuccess(long).

      • buildSuccessfulReadResult

        private static long buildSuccessfulReadResult​(long slot,
                                              long generation,
                                              long pointer,
                                              GBPTreeGenerationTarget generationTarget)

      • write

        public static long write​(PageCursor cursor,
                         long pointer,
                         long stableGeneration,
                         long unstableGeneration)
        Writes a GSP at one of the GSPP slots A/B, returning the result. Check success/failure using isSuccess(long) and if failure extract more information using failureDescription(long).
        Parameters:
        cursor - PageCursor to write to, placed at the beginning of the GSPP.
        pointer - pageId to write.
        stableGeneration - stable index generation.
        unstableGeneration - unstable index generation, which will be the generation to write in the slot.
        Returns:
        true on success, otherwise false on failure.

      • pointerState

        static byte pointerState​(long stableGeneration,
                         long unstableGeneration,
                         long generation,
                         long pointer,
                         boolean checksumIsCorrect)
        Pointer state of a GSP (generation, pointer, checksum). Can be any of:
        • STABLE
        • UNSTABLE
        • CRASH
        • BROKEN
        • EMPTY
        Parameters:
        stableGeneration - stable generation.
        unstableGeneration - unstable generation.
        generation - GSP generation.
        pointer - GSP pointer.
        checksumIsCorrect - whether or not GSP checksum matches checksum of generation and pointer.
        Returns:
        one of the available pointer states.

      • isSuccess

        static boolean isSuccess​(long result)
        Checks to see if a result from read/write was successful. If not more failure information can be extracted using failureDescription(long).
        Parameters:
        result - result from read(PageCursor, long, long, GBPTreeGenerationTarget) or write(PageCursor, long, long, long).
        Returns:
        true if successful read/write, otherwise false.

      • pointer

        static long pointer​(long readResult)
        Parameters:
        readResult - whole read result from read(PageCursor, long, long, GBPTreeGenerationTarget), containing both pointer as well as header information about the pointer.
        Returns:
        the pointer-part of readResult.

      • failureDescription

        static String failureDescription​(long result)
        Calling read(PageCursor, long, long, GBPTreeGenerationTarget) (potentially also write(PageCursor, long, long, long)) can fail due to seeing an unexpected state of the two GSPs. Failing right there and then isn't an option due to how the page cache works and that something read from a PageCursor must not be interpreted until after passing a PageCursor.shouldRetry() returning false. This creates a need for including failure information in result returned from these methods so that, if failed, can have the caller which interprets the result fail in a proper place. That place can make use of this method by getting a human-friendly description about the failure.
        Parameters:
        result - result from read(PageCursor, long, long, GBPTreeGenerationTarget) or write(PageCursor, long, long, long).
        Returns:
        a human-friendly description of the failure.

      • assertSuccess

        static boolean assertSuccess​(long result)
        Asserts that a result is successful, otherwise throws IllegalStateException.
        Parameters:
        result - result returned from read(PageCursor, long, long, GBPTreeGenerationTarget) or write(PageCursor, long, long, long)
        Returns:
        true if successful, for interoperability with assert.
